newsitem.title: CENTRAL AFRICAN REPUBLIC: Cholera kills eight in Central African Republic.
newsitem.headline: Cholera kills eight in Central African Republic.

text.p: Cholera has killed eight people in the Central African Republic and infected 43, the former French colony's acting health minister said on Wednesday.
Eliane Mokodopo told state television that the outbreak coinciding with the rainy season was in the Kouango region on the Oubangui River.
The region is across the river from ousted Zairean dictator Mobutu Sese Seko's home region and host to tens of thousands of refugees from there.
